section.name: Think about it – Identify number of ELLs in AEFLA-funded programs in the U.S. (cont.)
section.summary:
The number of adult learners enrolled in ELA or IELCE programs may be higher than you think. The answer is d: 49 percent. Nationally, English language and literacy programs are in high demand. In fact, several states and territories had combined enrollment in English language programs (ELA, IELCE) of 60% or higher in the 2017-2018 program year, according to the National Reporting System, including:

  • Nevada, 72%
  • Massachusetts, 65%
  • California, 64%
  • New York, 63%
  • American Samoa, 61%
  • Illinois, 61%
  • Rhode Island, 60%
  • Florida, 60%

(graphic)

Alt text: A state map of the U.S. with the following states highlighted in purple: California, Nevada, Illinois, Florida, New York, Massachusetts, and Rhode Island. These states have greater than 60% of the total enrollment enrolled in ELA and IELCE programs.

These large numbers of ELLs in adult education programs shows that there is real need for serving ELLs, including the ELLs who may have disabilities.
